points: I design and implement software based solutions by leveraging my training in pure mathematics.

details.tagline: Scalable remote procedure calling with JRuby
description: A little experiment with nio4r (non-blocking asynchronous I/O), celluloid (actor based concurrency), and JRuby (super easy deployment) for building a scalable and plugin based orchestration mechanism.

details.tagline: Pure Ruby parser combinator library inspired by Peg.js and OMeta
description: Parser combinator library embedded and implemented in pure Ruby to help with designing parsers for network protocols, command line clients, programming languages, etc.

details.tagline: Parsers, compilers, virtual machines, interpreters, etc.
description: This project grew out of a need to understand fundamental concepts in programming languages. It currently contains parsers and compilers for different kinds of languages at various stages of completion.

details.tagline: Boilerplate for generating debian package repository structure
description: As an infrastructure and DevOps engineer I'm constantly setting up package repositories for deploying code. This process is non-trivial so automating it provides significant gains in productivity.

Instead of constantly constructing AWS cluster configurations manually by hand I wanted a declarative way to do it. This project is a Python library built on top of boto that helps with provisioning and configuring AWS nodes in a nice and declarative format.
Same idea as for aot, i.e. declarative cloud cluster configurations, but written in Ruby and for OpenStack providers instead of AWS.

details.tagline: Declarative tmux layout configuration with a Ruby DSL
description: Ruby DSL for declarative tmux layout configuration along with command execution and nesting. Helpful when you have a tmux workspace that you want to re-create after a reboot.

items.title: Operations Engineer
details: I introduced modern provisioning and deployment practices into a legacy infrastructure by refactoring and improving Chef cookbooks and separating the provisioning pipeline from the deployment pipeline by introducing a build server and a Debian package repository into the existing workflows. This has significantly reduced the complexity and increased modularity of infrastructure code and tools.

items.title: DevOps Engineer
details: I developed tools for automating Hadoop cluster provisioning and reduced cluster spin-up times to minutes. Along the way I also developed tools for managing AWS clusters and integrated those tools with Jenkins and Atlassian Bamboo, a continuous integration server.

items.title: Software Engineer
details: I developed Chef based tools and migrated the old Puppet based infrastructure to Debian packages with Chef based pre/post-install logic. This reduced the complexity of the infrastructure maintenace code and was a big hit with developers because it brought the infrastructure under their control and helped them better manage the deployment and provisioning of their software with greater precision.

items.title: Software Test Engineer
details: I wrote ray tracing software in C# for validating correctness of software that controlled fields of heliostats. My ray tracer was several orders of magnitude faster than any previously built versions and helped track down a bug in the heliostat tracking table generator that had been in production for 4+ years. Previous ray tracers had been unable to detect the bug because it took days to run a simulation and my ray tracer was able to reduce that time to mere minutes and provide faster feedback.
